results.title: WR. Mysteries of the organism (E)
results.brief_description: Dusan Makavejev’s collage approach to “Wr. Mysteries of the Organism” effectively connects a disparate collection of themes, styles and ideas, starting with a documentary on controversial Polish born sexologist Wilheim Reich, a panorama of the American sexual revolution of the 60’s and 70’s, and finally, a satire set in the former Yugoslavia on the sexually repressive nature of authoritarian movements. The Reich segment covers the famed psychologists career from his flight from Europe in the late 30’s to his settlement in the United States where he established his research laboratory. His unconventional studies on ‘orgone energy’, coupled with his communist background made him a prime target for McCarthy’s communist witchhunts, resulting in his books being burned and his eventual incarceration and death in prison. Makavejev juxtaposes Reich’s life work with a fictional narrative of a liberated Yugoslavian woman (Milena Dravic), trying to enlighten a politically indocrinated and repressed Russian skater (Vladimir Ilyich) to the Reichian ethos of revolution via free love. In English language with some subtitles (Note: This particular version of “Wr. Mysteries of the Organism” is a modified version specially prepared by Makavejev to comply with British television standards.) See also “The Switchboard operator” (1969), “The Coca Cola kid” (1985).

results.title: Woyzeck. Heart of glass
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog Filmproduktion, Walter Saxer and Werner Herzog
results.brief_description: Woyzeck (1979): This film portrays the tragedy of a soldier who kills his unfaithful mistress who has had his child. He hears terrifying voices, he is victimised by his superiors and, in order to support his child, he takes part in a scientific experiment which results in his malnutrition. All or any of these factors could be the cause of his apparent madness. Cast includes: Klaus Kinski and Eva Mattes. “Heart of Glass” (1976): This visionary film with a resemblance to a folk tale is set around 1800. It begins with a prophet shepherd describing the Apocalypse. In the valley below, the foreman of a glass factory has died and with him the secret of producing an exquisite glass ruby from which the whole community lives. In his search for the formula, the factory owner is overcome with a madness that engulfs the village. Cast includes: Clemens Scheitz and Sonja Skiba. Both films in German with English subtitles.

results.title: WOW: women of the world
results.creator_credit: Hubley Studios, World Council of Churches and Faith Hubley
results.brief_description: Looks at the evolution of human liberation from the era of male and female hunters in professional and personal relationships. This is an interesting, inventive animated film.

results.title: Woven in time
results.brief_description: Features three woven ballets designed by Evelyn Roth, and interpreted by Tony Westman, in which the dancers work in and around various textures such as rope, netting and plastic.

results.title: Would You Like to Fly?
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division, Kingcroft Productions and John Kingsford-Smith
results.brief_description:
This film was produced by John Kingsford-Smith, nephew of the renowned aviator Charles Kingsford-Smith. John Kingsford-Smith became a successful and prolific producer of documentaries from 1948 to the 1980s. During this time he produced 327 sponsored films and commercials and played a key creative role in all of them (as writer, director, cinematographer or editor).

This film is a combination of his two passions, aviation and filmmaking; one may wonder how many people were spurred on to learn how to fly after watching this film!

results.title: Would you kiss a naked man? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Northern Century Productions, Mary McLeod and R. Alan Gough
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in sexuality”.
Demonstrates that sexuality and nudity are a natural part of an honest relationship between two people who care for one another by presenting a dramatized interlude between two teenagers in which they discuss the meaning of their relationship and engage in sexual play. From the series “Concepts in Sexuality”.

results.title: Would I lie to you = la verite si je mens
results.creator_credit: Vertigo Productions, France Z, M6 Films, Orly Films, Les Productions Jacque Roiffeld, Aissa Djabri, Farid Lahouassa, Manuel Munz and Thomas Gilou
results.brief_description: No job, no home, no family; Eddie (Richard Anconina) has hit rock bottom. One day, as he is walking through Le Sentier (the rag trade district of Paris) he is attacked by a gang of hustlers. Rescued by Victor Benzakem (Richard Bohringer), a successful rag-trader who mistakes Eddie for a Sephardic Jew, Eddie is offered a job. Only too happy to seize an opportunity to start over, Eddie (who is a gentile) tries his best to maintain the pretence of his adopted ‘jewishness’. From the fabric warehouse, Eddie is given an opportunity to observe the rites and secret hand shakes of the flashy, fast talking garment district: a melting pot of race, religion and culture. His eyes also catch the beauty of his employer’s daughter, Sandra (Amira Casar). In order to draw her attention, Eddie decides to cut loose and start his own business. Starting with the classic story of the stranger who finds himself in a community he knows nothing about, Thomas Gilou’s film presents a seldom-seen look into the lives and customs of France’s many ethnic groups. Cast includes Richard Anconina, Amira Casar, Vincent Elbaz, Elie Kakou, Richard Bohringer, and Jose Garcia.

results.title: Would I ever like to work
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Kathleen Shannon and Len Chatwin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Joan is a welfare mother with seven children. Originally from the Maritimes, she now lives in Montreal. She would like to work as a waitress, and feels she’d be a better mother if she could. But day care costs more than she can afford.
